endava.description:
Migration and development of a web platform designed for public companies, used for managing allocated shares, reviewing shareholders, monitoring dividends, and generating reports.
Direction of the team on technical matters and overall oversight of the project. Responsibilities included designing architectural solutions, defining communication between application services, and establishing strategies for resolving technical challenges.
Management of the project's technical debt – identification of problem areas, prioritization of resolutions, and negotiation with business stakeholders for time to implement necessary improvements. Ensuring smooth application deployments to production environments through implementation and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines. Design and implementation of collaboration models between development and QA teams, supporting efficient workflow.
Collaboration with the business unit on planning product development roadmaps for upcoming quarters and defining the technical aspects of planned features.

eqtek.description: Developing and maintaining case management system platform. Designing and implementing short-term tailored projects for multiple clients from the British public sector and banking. Line management for a team of around ten devs and QAs, supporting communication with business and helping improving software development process.

vsoft.description: Maintaining web application used by sales representatives to evaluate complex insurance configurations.

flightscope.pm-description:
Evaluating, planning and designing architecture for multiple software projects.
Coordinating communication between offices (Poland, South Africa and USA) and synchronizing co-operation of teams (project owners, UI designers, engineers, etc.).
Prioritizing tasks and projects in regard to the available resources and the market demand.
Managing a few small software teams on all levels.
flightscope.leader-description: I kept the previous duties. On top of that, I started designing software architecture, planning project development and overseeing the process, as well as managing a team of a few developers.
flightscope.dev-description: Developing and maintaining applications used by golfers (both professional and amateur) to improve their skills by analyzing ball flight data provided by multiple sport radars.

masters.title: Master's Degree
masters.desc: A diploma thesis on the subject "System for decoding Morse code with the use of software-defined radio" realized in the form of an application that performs real-time digital audio signal processing, written in C ++.

hobby.title: After work
hobby.brewing-description:
Brewing your own beer might seem as a complicating and demanding task. And that's exactly how it is... After a several dozen of batches, I still feel I barely starting exploring the hoppy world.

Regardless of results, I love experimenting with beer styles - planning, mashing and seeing to fermentation. It's not the same with sticking labels or cleaning the kitchen afterwards. But no pain, no gain...
hobby.squash-description:
To remain healthy, both physically and mentally, I simply must sweat a bit, from time to time.

I'm definitely not one of those, who can set their own challenges by going further or faster. I need an demanding opponent of flesh and blood on the other side of the court. Sometimes I win and sometimes I loose, but the most important part is this thrill between the first and last ball of the match.
hobby.traveling-description:
I won't be the first one to say it, but I love to travel. The further and more exotic my destination is - the better. And it's not only about the sights and architecture. I really enjoy observing peculiarities of all the different places and cultures.

And the most interesting are... markets. It's always the regular food shop, where you can clearly see the differences between countries - by the taste, scent and likes of the natives.

about-me.title: About me
content: Solving complex technical problems that programming offers has always excited me. Figuring out the right algorithm and bringing it to life step by step gives me immense satisfaction.

However, building advanced systems is far more than just implementation. It involves conscious architectural choices, anticipating future requirements and potential bottlenecks. This requires deep understanding not only of technical aspects but also business goals and team constraints. Many people with diverse skills and perspectives must work in harmony to reach a common objective – and overseeing this process, identifying risks before they materialize, and supporting efficient team execution is as compelling to me as the code itself.

I cannot remain indifferent when I see suboptimal approaches, short-sighted solutions, or lack of planning. I strive to be constructive, but I won't stay silent when I believe something threatens the project or team. If this occasionally gives me a reputation for being stubborn, I accept it – because I believe it's a leader's responsibility.
